label: @AUDIOLINENUMBER
description: This variable contains the line number within the audio poster where the current session is running. The audio poster supports up to 128 lines.

label: @AUDIOSTATE
description: This variable identifies the state the specfile is in at this point in the procedure. @AUDIOSTATE always begins with the character value START as the first state.

label: @AUDIOMESSAGEINFO1
description: This variable contains the information for the audio response unit to play to the caller.

label: @AUDIOMESSAGEINFO2
description: This variable contains the information for the audio response unit to play to the caller.

description: This variable contains the information for the audio response unit to play to the caller.

label: @AUDIOMESSAGEINFO10
description: This variable contains the information for the audio response unit to play to the caller.

label: @AUDIODATATYPE
description:
This variable determines the type of data to be input.

Include the file RD.AUDIO.DEF to use pre-defined data type variable names.

AUDIODATATYPENONE=0

Tells the audio response unit to terminate the specfile and return control to the audio response system

AUDIODATATYPEMONEY=1

Audio data types 1, 2, 3, 4, and 6 allow the caller to type a series of digits, using the pound sign (#) to indicate when finished. For these input types, the asterisk (*) causes the system to repeat the prompt and start the input again.

AUDIODATATYPEDATE=2
AUDIODATATYPENUMBER=3
AUDIODATATYPEYESNO=4
AUDIODATATYPEMENU=5

Accepts a single key as input. The caller can press any of the 12 keys.

AUDIODATATYPECHARACTER=6
AUDIODATATYPEENDCALL=7

Causes the system to disconnect the call after the messages have played.

label: @AUDIOUSERINPUT
description: At the beginning of each state, this variable contains the caller's input from the previous prompt.
